info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 1:45AM CDT until July 28 at 9:48PM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant Hill MO
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri...
Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wakenda Creek at Carrollton.
* WHEN...Until late Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying undeveloped areas along the creek begins. At 19.1 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the South Main Street bridge over Wakenda Creek. At 19.8 feet, South Main Street along with Stonewall Street and Wabash Road on the south side of Carrollton are overtopped by flood waters. Flood waters also threaten businesses in low-lying areas near the creek. At 20.7 feet, Wakenda Creek begins to flood the first floors of businesses along South Main Street in Carrollton. At 21.1 feet, Water overtops the South Main Street bridge.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 19.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING
